data.title: Demon Slayer season 4 release schedule: When is episode 7 out?
data.meta_description: Demon Slayer season 4 is now streaming on Crunchyroll, but when will the next instalment debut on the platform?
data.text:
Tanjiro Kamado and his allies undergo Hashira Training, which is led by the Hashira and designed to prepare the gang for battle against Muzan Kibutsuji.

Tanjiro voice actor Natsuki Hanae spoke with RadioTimes.com exclusively earlier this year and teased that fans will see "a lot more training and action" in the new season, and that fans will be able to "get behind their favourite characters".

Episode 6, The Strongest of the Demon Slayer Corps, landed on Sunday (16th June). But when does Episode 7 land? Read on for everything you need to know about the release schedule of Demon Slayer season 4.

More like this

When is Demon Slayer season 4 episode 7 out?

The seventh episode of Demon Slayer Season 4 is expected to arrive on Crunchyroll on Sunday 23rd June, one week after the sixth episode arrived.

The first episode was a one-hour premiere, which has already been released in the form of a movie, Demon Slayer: Kimetsu no Yaiba – To the Hashira Training.

The second, Water Hashira – Giyuu Tomioka's Pain, followed Tanjiro, who was resting at the butterfly mansion, as he hunted for answers after receiving a letter from Kagaya.

Demon Slayer season 4 release schedule

The Hashira Training arc is the shortest arc within the Demon Slayer manga series, meaning that this season will be the shortest one yet, running at just 8 episodes.

However, the official X account for Demon Slayer has announced that the final two episodes of the season will be airing in longer time slots. This starts with episode 7 airing in a 40-minute time slot and episode 8 airing in a 60-minute time slot, compared to the regular 30 minutes the other episodes have had.

Here's the schedule for Demon Slayer season 4 so far. We will update this as the season progresses and we get more information:

Episode 1: To Defeat Muzan Kibutsuji - Sunday 12th May (out now)

Episode 2: Water Hashira Giyu Tomioka's Pain – Sunday 19th May (out now)

Episode 3: Fully Recovered Tanjiro Joins the Hashira Training – Sunday 26th May (out now)

Episode 4: To Bring a Smile to One's Face – Sunday 2nd June (out now)

Episode 5: I Even Ate Demons - Sunday 9th June (out now)

Episode 6: The Strongest of the Demon Slayer Corps - Sunday 16th June (out now)

Episode 7: TBC - Sunday 23rd June

Episode 8: TBC - Sunday 30th June *Final Episode of the Season*

How to watch Demon Slayer in the UK

Anime fans in the UK can find episodes of Demon Slayer, both new and old, available for subscribers to stream on Crunchyroll.

The hit show sits alongside other anime favourites such as One Piece, Solo Leveling and My Hero Academia.

Who Are The Demon Slayer Season 4 Cast?

Tanjiro Kamado - Natsuki Hanae / Zach Aguilar

Nezuko Kamado - Akari Kito / Abby Trott

Zenitsu Agatsuma - Hiro Shimono / Aleks Le

Inosuke Hashibira - Yoshitsugu Matsuoka / Bryce Papenbrook

Giyu Tomioka - Takahiro Sakurai / Johnny Yong Bosch

Tengen Uzui - Katsuyuki Konishi / Ray Chase

Shinobu Kocho - Saori Hayami / Erika Harlacher

Mitsuri Kanroji - Kana Hanazawa / Kira Buckland

Is there a Demon Slayer season 4 trailer?

Yes. You can watch the trailer for Demon Slayer right here now.

You can catch Demon Slayer on Crunchyroll. Sign up to Crunchyroll today for as little as £4.99 ($6.40) or start your 14-day free trial.
